text:
input variable depend upon one another. For example, the observation at time t is dependent
upon the observation at t− 1; t− 1 may depend on t− 2, and so on. An input variable is an
exogenous variable if it is independent of other variables in the system and the output variable
depends upon it. Put simply, endogenous variables are inﬂuenced by other variables in the
system (including themselves) whereas as exogenous variables are not and are considered as
outside the system.
